name: Phase Spider
lore: Phase spiders are large, predatory spiders capable of shifting between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. They use this ability to ambush prey, phasing into existence to deliver a venomous bite before retreating to the Ethereal Plane to avoid retaliation. Their lairs are often draped in webs that span both planes.

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.description: The phase spider can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane and vice versa.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The phase spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.description: The phase spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webs.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) Piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) Poison damage. If the Poison damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target has the Stable condition but also has the Poisoned condition for 1 hour, and while Poisoned in this way, the target also has the Paralyzed condition.

hit.additionalEffects: If the Poison damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target has the Stable condition but also has the Poisoned condition for 1 hour, and while Poisoned in this way, the target also has the Paralyzed condition.

bonusActions.name: Ethereal Jaunt
bonusActions.description: The phase spider magically shifts from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.
